item.title: Kony 2012 and Invisible Children are Funded by Antigay Creationist Groups
item.description: #InvisibleChildren backed by extreme right-wing anti-gay money? #NOH8 http://t.co/zDtoDM7W
item.content:encoded: #InvisibleChildren backed by extreme right-wing anti-gay money? #NOH8 http://t.co/zDtoDM7W We're still waiting on the new Kony 2012 video, supposedly slated to go live later today, that will answer all of our concerns about Invisible Children's finances and goals, but we have some idea of what we can expect: earnest proclamations about how "uncomplicated" it is to bring Joseph Kony down and reassurances that Invisible Children does spend some of their money (37%) on-the-ground in Africa. Here's what we're nearly 100% sure we won't see: answers regarding the nonprofit's antigay, creationist donors. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: jezebel.com

item.title: Articles: Democrats Kill Wisconsin Jobs to Spite Governor Scott Walker
item.description: #tcot #tlot Democrats Kill Wisconsin Jobs to Spite Governor Scott Walker: Killing 600 initial jobs, and as many ... http://t.co/Y9jPAGg2
item.content:encoded: #tcot #tlot Democrats Kill Wisconsin Jobs to Spite Governor Scott Walker: Killing 600 initial jobs, and as many ... http://t.co/Y9jPAGg2 On March 6, every Democrat in the Wisconsin State Senate, and one Republican, voted down a bill that could have streamlined the permit process and permitted the development of an iron mine in a depressed area of northern Wisconsin. The mine would have initially employed 600 to 700 workers (eventually as many as 2,200) and injected at least 1.5 billion dollars into the local economy. Additionally, it would have proven a boon to Joy Manufacturing and Falk Corp., two major manufacturers of mining equipment located in Milwaukee. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: americanthinker.com

item.title: Kids Are Heroes - Timmy Tyrell
item.description: Our newest hero is Timmy who races for his friend who is a cancer victim. http://t.co/pp9Yfnou
item.content:encoded: Our newest hero is Timmy who races for his friend who is a cancer victim. http://t.co/pp9Yfnou Timmy "Mini" Tyrrell decided in 2010 (age 6) that he wanted to help children with cancer after his friend, Ella, had been diagnosed with a brain tumor. After witnessing her battle and hearing the adults discuss the hardships Ella's parents were suffering financially, Mini wanted to start raising money through his go kart racing in order to help others like Ella and her family. This idea became a reality in the fall of 2010, after Inspired Athletes came to watch Mini race at Old Dominion Speedway in Manassas, Virginia. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: kidsareheroes.org

item.title: U.S. Army Sergeant Suspected in Afghanistan Shooting
item.description: U.S. Sergeant Is Said to Kill 16 Civilians in Afghanistan - http://t.co/inZmZwiu - #world
item.content:encoded: U.S. Sergeant Is Said to Kill 16 Civilians in Afghanistan - http://t.co/inZmZwiu - #world Nine children were among the dead after an American soldier stalked from home to home in attacks in a rural stretch of southern Afghanistan, Afghan and American officials said. Link - Trackbacks

item.title: Gas prices sink Obama’s ratings on economy, bring parity to race for White House
item.description: As gasoline prices rise, Obama’s ratings fall http://t.co/iIotpXzX
item.content:encoded: As gasoline prices rise, Obama’s ratings fall http://t.co/iIotpXzX Disapproval of the president’s handling of the economy is heading higher as a record number of Americans now give him negative reviews on the 2012 election’s most important issue, according to a poll. Link - Trackbacks
